p: Kamatou [ 29] examined the EO composition of S. africana-caerulea L. and S. lanceolata Lam. and found oxygenated sesquiterpenes as the predominant constituents (58.7% and 47.9%, respectively), mostly represented by spatulenol (29.1% and 18.3%, respectively) and caryophyllene oxide (14.0â€“15.0%). This chemical class, although present in all the examined species in consistent percentages (33.5% in S. aurea, 29.5% in S. dentata, and 15.8% in S. scabra), did not predominate in any of them. The highest percentage of caryophyllene oxide was found in S. aurea (3.6%) and S. scabra (3.4%), while its level in S. dentata did not exceed 0.2%. A small percentage of spatulenol, on the other hand, was present only in S. scabra.
